meanings.definition: The state or quality of being excessively long or wordy in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her prolixities in the essay made it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The professor's prolixities in his lectures bored the students.
meanings.sent3: Despite his prolixities, he managed to convey his point effectively.
meanings.sent4: The prolixities of the legal document were overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The prolixities of the novel made it a challenging read.

meanings.definition: An instance of being overly verbose or tedious in communication.
meanings.sent1: The prolixities of his speech made the audience lose interest.
meanings.sent2: I tried to avoid her prolixities during our conversation.
meanings.sent3: His prolixities at the meeting caused everyone to yawn.
meanings.sent4: The prolixities of the sales pitch failed to convince the customers.
meanings.sent5: We were exhausted by the prolixities of the presentation.
